definitions.definition: to make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc.:
examples: To ease the problem of overcrowding, new prisons will be built.

definitions.definition: the state of experiencing no difficulty, effort, pain, etc.:
examples: She won the 400 metre race with ease.

definitions.definition: If someone, especially a soldier, is at ease, they are standing with their feet apart and their hands behind their back.
